column2: VERMONT DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. At a railroad crossing drivers:
column4: must stop at least 5 feet from the nearest rail.
column6: should check for a train that may be approaching and drive around a closed railroad gate.
column8:
should start across
immediately after a train passes.
column10: must stop at least 15 feet from the nearest rail when there are flashing lights.

column2: 2. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 3. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 4. As you approach a right turn, your vehicle should be _________ the right side of the road.

6. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:

8. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column6: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 9. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column8: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column10: You must make a complete stop

column2: 11. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.

column4: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column6: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.

column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 15. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".

17. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.

19. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 20. This sign indicates that:
